story.soThat: I can start building the core features with all dependencies and standards in place
story.tasks: - [ ] Initialize Vite + React + TypeScript project (AC: 1) - [ ] Run `npm create vite@latest . -- --template react-ts` to create project structure - [ ] Install dependencies with `npm install` - [ ] Verify project builds successfully with `npm run build` - [ ] Start development server with `npm run dev` to confirm setup works - [ ] Configure ESLint and Prettier for code quality (AC: 2, 3) - [ ] Install ESLint with TypeScript and React support dependencies - [ ] Create .eslintrc.json with TypeScript, React, and recommended rules - [ ] Install and configure Prettier with code formatting standards - [ ] Integrate Prettier with ESLint for consistent code style - [ ] Verify linting works with `npm run lint` command - [ ] Create Hello World component (AC: 4) - [ ] Create basic React component with TypeScript props interface - [ ] Implement HelloWorld component following PascalCase naming [Source: docs/architecture/component-standards.md] - [ ] Add component to main App.tsx for rendering - [ ] Verify component renders on main page in development mode - [ ] Set up testing framework (AC: 5) - [ ] Install Vitest and related testing dependencies - [ ] Configure vitest.config.ts with TypeScript and React support - [ ] Create basic passing test for HelloWorld component [Source: docs/architecture/testing-requirements.md] - [ ] Verify tests run successfully with `npm test` command

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Foundation & Core Functionality
doc.snippet: This epic aligns with the established frontend architecture by implementing: React 18 + TypeScript: Functional components with strict typing for robust date logic. Vite Build System: Fast development server and optimized production builds. Component Structure: Follows `/src/components`, `/src/context`, `/src/services`, `/src/utils` organization.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Foundation & Core Functionality
doc.snippet: Core Framework Dependencies: Framework - react ^18.3.1, react-dom ^18.3.1. Language - typescript ^5.6.3. Build Tool - vite ^5.4.8. Testing - vitest ^2.1.4. Development Tooling Dependencies: ESLint with TypeScript and React rules, Prettier for formatting.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Foundation & Core Functionality
doc.snippet: Story 1.1: Project Setup. 1. The project is initialized as a Vite + React + TypeScript static web application. 2. ESLint is configured and functional with TypeScript and React rules. 3. Prettier is configured and integrates with ESLint. 4. A simple "Hello World" component renders on the main page. 5. Vitest is installed and configured with a basic passing test.

doc.title: Project Structure
doc.snippet: The project will follow a standard Vite + React + TS structure with /src/components, /src/context, /src/services, /src/utils organization. All logic must be client-side.

doc.title: Component Standards
doc.snippet: Components: PascalCase (e.g., HolidayForm.tsx). All components should be React functional components using TypeScript with proper props interfaces.

doc.title: Testing Requirements
doc.snippet: We will use Vitest and React Testing Library for all unit tests. Coverage Goals: Aim for 100% coverage on dateLogic.ts. Test Structure: Arrange-Act-Assert.
